{"step_by_step_thinking": "Sinusitis is an inflammation or swelling of the tissue lining the sinuses. When they become blocked and filled with fluid, germs can grow and cause an infection. The radiographic features of sinusitis include fluid levels, which indicate the presence of fluid in the sinuses, and clouding of antra, which is a sign of inflammation or infection. Erosion of bone is not a typical feature of sinusitis, it is more associated with chronic conditions or invasive fungal sinusitis. Therefore, the answer should include both fluid levels and clouding of antra.", "answer_choice": "D. Clouding and fluid level"}
